newsitem.title: USA: USWC crude jumps with WTI in otherwise thin trade.
newsitem.headline: USWC crude jumps with WTI in otherwise thin trade.

text.p: U.S. West Coast crude prices jumped Tuesday with West Texas Intermediate (WTI), after a barge accident and technical rally lifted futures markets, players said.
Talk was thin Tuesday, with most West Coast crude traders attending an industry function which runs through Tuesday.
Discounts for light grades were unchanged from Friday, with Alaska North Slope (ANS) last done at -$0.91 cents off WTI. Line 63 prices were idle at postings plus $0.95 to $1.00.
Technical strength and a shutdown of barge traffic on the Mississippi River sent NYMEX crude prices up $1.14 a barrel.
